result.execSummary:
The defendant Melonie Kay Dent was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).
  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to prison sentence through Walworth Co.

miscConds.notes: $518 costs--DOC collect.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary.
Take any medications as prescribed by licensed physician.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with count 1; consecutive to prison sentence through Walworth Co.

Defendant Melonie Kay Dent in court in custody with attorney Philip J. Brehm.  Cheniqua White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guilty plea to both counts, Court finds defendant guilty.  Sentence withheld, Court orders 3 years probation, each count concurrent but consecutive to Walworth Co prison case; conditions of probation:  any treatment deemed necessary; take all medications as prescribed by licensed physician; DOC collect $1,036 costs; no sentence credit if revoked.
